Slow         Takes long to compile         Hard to use translucent and not translucent material   Test test and test again!

Title: Particle effect collisions
Comment: dampening factor is how rubbery something behaves when colliding, If using scene depth for gpu particles and you don't see the surface particles wont collide, stop collision setting can be used for painting on a surface  distance field if collisions can't use scene depth, has performance concerns though! distance field is per asset and not per instance,   if having 2 collisions for an emitter it uses the last one in emitter list, so if you want 2 types of collisions need to have 2 emitters, attaches 1 emitter to another  EventGenerators for cpu emitters, in this example on collision hit spawn a new emitter, gpu particles doesn't inherit velocity same as cpu particles if spawned  3d sphere mask to move a opacity mask in world space or color mask!

Title: Physical Animations
Comment: that is one floppy mannequin! pxvis collision command, They show how to add constraints to a mannequin, Anti-aliasing post-process doesn't work well with debug lines

Title: Procedural mesh slicing
Comment: If using static mesh for procedurally generated mesh enable CPU access in the mesh, *chop* *chop* *chop*, Ian is abusing the mesh! Ian's laughter at 1:29:05, If using this slicing technique it has to be procedurally meshes, not skeletal meshes e.t.c.

Links from Sam: shaderbits.com/blog/uv-dilation - About dilation and padding with textures. https://www.unrealengine.com/en-US/blog/getting-the-most-out-of-noise-in-ue4 - Lots of useful information about noise  Can right click a render target to create a static texture, They alter the height of a mesh using render target, Enable Support UV from hit results

Title: Hierarchical Level of Detail
Comment: Is good for reducing draw calls for a level. Enable hierarchical in world settings - LODSystem, Can re-generate a single cluster to speed up re-building

Title: Cable Component and 4.14 Features
Comment: Cable stiffness helps prevent buckle back on itself, Increasing substep time decreases chance of cable ending up in a bad way, The cable doesn't function as a spring so if it's applied to an actor that falls forever the cable gets infinite length

Title: Blueprint Line and Shape Traces
Comment: you can not trace complex against Skeletal meshes - you will only get the physics asset Doing 36 000 line traces affects performance a bit! Doing 360 capsule traces affects performance a tiny bit.  Location is the location of the sphere when hit, Impact point is the point where the sphere overlapped with the traced object  When doing trace it needs to move a unit, if the distance moved is 0 no hits are returned. Predict projectile path for projectiles if predicting

Title: Spline Importing
Comment: 3ds max script to export spline data ( xyz, tangent in xyz,  tangent out xyz ) and then transform data correctly in unreal engine, the coordinate system between 3ds max and unreal has inverted Y axis, can drag and drop csv files!   blutility to run blueprint functions in editor

Title: Getting Started with Landscapes
Comment: Help -> Console Variables -> Open ConsoleHelp.html that has all console commands, "ConsoleCommand ?" - shows an explanation and default value of the written command  Landscape technical guide has really good in depth guide. Lit -> Exposure -> Fixed at Log 0 can fix bright surfaces Ctrl 1 - 3 -> 9? to bind the camera position and rotation to 1 - > 3 Shared Wrap texture setting in material bypasses DX10 and below limitation of max 4 layers per landscape component If you see flickering can try to change ZBounds extension,  flickering is most likely displacement pushed outside component bounds.  To break up tiling there are macro texture variations in starter content as example that adds some random noise, World Composition is for large open worlds

Title: Lighting Techniques and Guides
Comment: Capsule shadow to have soft shadows in already shadowed area, Scaling meshes can be bad as it stretches the baked lightmaps, Far shadow distance for large landscapes, If doing day/night cycle it's better to turn off light when its under the world  Emissive for static lights require a good lightmap resolution, DumpUnbuiltLightingInteractions lists actors that doesn't have built lighting

Title: Getting Started with AI
Comment: https://askagamedev.tumblr.com/post/76972636953/game-development-myths-players-want-smart  Video is a short summary of the Make Game Ready AI series pretty much, Shows how to create a grab animation at ~11m with animation, Red line in behavior tree means failure, white means attempt

Title: Creating Semi Procedural Materials
Comment: Has a project assets download link to go through in the editor, Random interiors in windows for buildings e.t.c., Call In editor checkbox for function or event creates a blutility!

Title: Getting Started with Landscapes Materials and Foliage
Comment: Foliage instanced mesh documentation for in depth guide, Select Invalid selects foliage not touching the ground as CLEARLY demonstrated! If landscape lighting isn't looking right try the Use Landscape Lightmap checkbox, Windy tree gone extreme ~44m

Title: Destructible Editor Features and Guide
Comment: Unreal content level to look at examples with different settings, The mesh has to be a whole mesh or when it fractures it most likely gets holes, Destructible meshes doesn't work on mobile in 4.15 and below, Don't think it works in 4.16 and above.  Editor destructibles has 1 depth whereas externally done through example physXLab has up to 5.

Title: Robo Recall Sequencer Cinematics
Comment: If building cinematics for VR try and build the scene around the camera. Like in the Robo Recall where everything happens around the player.

Title: Replication
Comment: IsLocallyControlled() can be used to example hide third person mesh for self but not other players  Can use OwnerNoSee in visibility settings instead also, Can add SocketPreview in skeletal mesh editor  Static Mesh replicate movement checkbox, however the server has no idea client has fired a projectile so boxes only moves if server fires gun. To solve the client spawning projectile need a server fire event that spawns the projectile (RPC) . RPC = Remote Procedure Calls   Net Cull Distance decides if the client needs to get the data for that actor or not, Console commands to simulate packet loss and delay

Title: Getting Started with Level Streaming
Comment: There's a editor content level to showcase the level streaming, WorldComposition for open worlds and streaming levels where you know player is moving

Title: Lighting Techniques and Guides 2: Dynamic Lighting
Comment: Distance field (DF) shadows difference in resolution and texture size. If DF self-shadows have artifacts at edges in the Light Source for directional light setting "Ray Start Offset Depth Scale". Or in static mesh editor try to use Distance Field Bias.  Contact shadow is a screen space shadow technique so don't use it alone, IES = Illuminating  Engineering Society ! Can be useful for faking shadows if I understood correctly for performance.   If scene never uses static lighting disable it in rendering settings, Can use World Settings -> Force No Precomputed Lighting for per level setting  In the editor learning resource EffectsCave for cave lighting and particle effect, Can use a hidden low poly mesh to be used for shadows instead of high poly models

Title: Getting Started with World Composition
Comment: They use World Machine software to make the heightmaps,

Title: Getting Started with C++
Comment: Goes through UProperty and basic c++ things, 0.5 is a double by default, 0.5f is a float,  CDO =  class default object that all other classes will copy from when engine starts

Title: Getting Started in VR
Comment: When learning VR learning resources:   * Showdown VR Demo ( Learn Tab Demo )  * NVIDIA VR Fun House  ( Modding Launcher Tab ) * Robo Recall ( Modding Launcher Tab, Oculus exclusive)  Ocular Vestibular Mismatch = VR Sickness! VR editor is cool

Title: Realtime Simulation and Volume Modelling Plugin
Comment: Happy face cloud, Pressure Diviser to at least 2 for performance, Useful for simulating and then render to a texture, [unroll] on loops in shader code for more accurate shader complexity when using loops

Title: Getting Started with Character Morph Targets
Comment: Important to name everything for less confusion! Morph modifier has to be beneath the skin modifier or it gets nullified (in 3ds max I think), ramp up normal map to make characters look old or add wrinkles

Title: Animation Pose Snapshot
Comment: To quickly reset the physics asset without having to reset rotation e.t.c. inside physics editor:  - Hierarchy Bones with bodies  - Collision geometry: Sphere  - Add new body to root bone  - Physics type: Kinematic  - Turn off collisions  - Go to constraints  - For pelvis set linear limits to Free instead of locked   Project download: https://epicgames.box.com/v/TwitchProjectDownload

Title: Blender to UE4
Comment: Trivia! mikktspace = Mikk from Morten S. Mikkelsen,  T space = tangent space Starts by showing off how to smooth groups and smooth artifacts, Hotkeys, many hotkeys :)  If you want to work with meters as scale in blender you need to set Units to meters and then unit scale to 0.01. Also turn off scale when exporting to FBX. It is easier to just do nothing though and keep the FBX scale as 1.0.

Title: Saving and Loading
Comment: There's no functionality that they know off to "cheat proof" a save game by obfuscating the data.

Title: C++ Q&A
Comment: AddDebugMessageToScreen(key, ... ) the key is an index and will overwrite the same message if it's not -1, If copy-pasting code from internet, copy-paste everything!

Title: Baking Materials to Textures
Comment: Guide on unrealengine.com "Render to Texture Blueprint toolset" https://docs.unrealengine.com/latest/INT/Engine/Content/Tools/RenderToTextureTools/Setup/index.html  Convert normal maps from HDR -> 8 bit. For Photoshop:  Open in photoshop -> Image -> Mode -> 8 Bit -> Method -> Exposure and Gamma -> OK !  Convert to world normals to tangent normals in Photoshop:  NVIDIA texture tools -> Alpha Field -> Set to 1.0 -> Alternate Conversions -> Max ( R, G, B ) -> OK  NVIDIA texture tools -> Alternate conversions -> normalize  LOD triangle reduction in percents is handy to quickly reduce triangle count! If using merge actors tool best to put UV coordinates within 0 -> 1 or might get pixelation artifacts or other artifacts when merging. The merge actors puts each actor into their own quadrant for the new UVs,  So better to work in even numbers. For example 3 meshes evenly splits the UV space into 4,  top left for 1 and so on.

Title: Getting Started with Post Processing
Comment: Video starts around ~12.30 , There's a content example for post processing in editor, For depth of field green is close blurring - blue is far blurring.

Title: Getting Started with Gameplay Programming
Comment: Video starts at ~5.55, is about creating a custom camera that smoothly follows player, preprocessor #if !UE_BUILD_SHIPPING

Title: Getting Started with Composure
Comment: Video starts at ~7.30, Composure is a plugin, They used real camera setup to take an IBL cubemap  It's important to use 24 fps film, or to match what you shot the footage as. The end goal of composure is to in real time be able to compose digital assets with real life assets but for now it's only pre-rendered.

Title: Depth and Location based effects
Comment: Location based opacity using a sphere mask. Used this technique for my game jam entry E For hugs. Willard also demonstrates similar things like using a texture for noise so the effect isn't applied to the whole mesh.
